comments.raw_text:
Right now we have a single logo that's 210px by 210px that gets scaled down to new sizes depending on the size of the content area.  Our scaling in the browser simply isn't good enough to not make our logo look kind of jaggy and crappy at anything but its actual native pixel dimensions. 

If it's possible, we should, rather than scaling the image with media queries, actually replace it with several appropriately sized images.
